month"}},"remainingTime()":{"returns":{"_0":"remaining"}},"requestCPIData()":{"returns":{"requestId":"for this request only allows 1 request per month after the 14th day callable by anyone after time duration","returns":{"_0":"timestamp"}}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"CPIMonthlyChangeRateUpdate(int256,int256)":{"notice":"event when the monthly change rate is Any change over this threshold in either direction will be rejected"},"TIMEFRAME()":{"notice":"the time frame over which all changes in CPI data are applied 28 days was chosen as that is the shortest length of a month"},"currentMonth()":{"notice":"the current month's CPI data"},"duration()":{"notice":"the duration of the timed period"},"fee()":{"notice":"amount in LINK paid to node operator for each request"},"fulfill(bytes32,uint256)":{"notice":"Receive the response in the form of uint256"},"getCurrentOraclePrice()":{"notice":"get the current scaled oracle price applies the change smoothly over a 28 day period scaled by 18 decimals"},"getMonthlyAPR()":{"notice":"get APR from chainlink data by measuring (current month - previous month) / previous month"},"isTimeEnded()":{"notice":"return true if time period has ended"},"jobId()":{"notice":"job id that retrieves the latest CPI data"},"monthlyChangeRateBasisPoints()":{"notice":"current amount that oracle price is inflating/deflating by monthly"},"previousMonth()":{"notice":"the previous month's CPI data"},"remainingTime()":{"notice":"number of seconds remaining until time is up"},"requestCPIData()":{"notice":"Create a Chainlink request to retrieve API response, find the target data, then multiply by 1000 (to remove decimal places from data)."},"startTime()":{"notice":"the start timestamp of the timed period"},"timeSinceStart()":{"notice":"number of seconds since contract was initialized"}},"notice":"Testing contract that allows for updates without mocking chainlink params._cpiData: latest CPI data from BLS called by the chainlink oracle

returns.percentageChange: percentage change in basis points over past month

returns.requestId: for this request only allows 1 request per month after the 14th day callable by anyone after time period and 14th day of the month

timeSinceStart().details: will be less than or equal to duration

MAXORACLEDEVIATION().notice: the maximum allowable deviation in basis points for a new chainlink oracle update only allow price changes by 20% in a month. Any change over this threshold in either direction will be rejected

TIMEFRAME().notice: the time frame over which all changes in CPI data are applied 28 days was chosen as that is the shortest length of a month

duration().notice: the duration of the timed period

fee().notice: amount in LINK paid to node operator for each request

fulfill(bytes32,uint256).notice: Receive the response in the form of uint256

getCurrentOraclePrice().notice: get the current scaled oracle price applies the change smoothly over a 28 day period scaled by 18 decimals

getMonthlyAPR().notice: get APR from chainlink data by measuring (current month - previous month) / previous month

isTimeEnded().notice: return true if time period has ended

jobId().notice: job id that retrieves the latest CPI data

monthlyChangeRateBasisPoints().notice: current amount that oracle price is inflating/deflating by monthly in basis points

oracle().notice: address of chainlink oracle to send request

oraclePrice().notice: oracle price. starts off at 1e18 and compounds monthly

remainingTime().notice: number of seconds remaining until time is up

requestCPIData().notice: Create a Chainlink request to retrieve API response, find the target data, then multiply by 1000 (to remove decimal places from data).

startTime().notice: the start timestamp of the timed period

timeSinceStart().notice: number of seconds since contract was initialized

documentation.text: @notice Testing contract that allows for updates without mocking chainlink calls
